bioghist.p: Paul Hopkins (b. 1916) served as the regional secretary for Africa for the Commission on Ecumenical Mission and Relations (COEMAR), 1968-1972; as the liaison with Africa under the Program Agency, 1972-1981; and as the liaison with the Middle East and the Middle East/Sudan under the Program Agency, 1981-1984. He is the author of What Next in Mission?, published in 1977.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Paul Hopkins relating to his work for COEMAR. Topics include inter-church relations, status of missions in Africa and the Middle East and relationships between UPCUSA and local churches, and overseas mission policies and the restructuring of the overseas mission program of the UPCUSA, including a proposed moratorium on missions in Africa (early 1970s). Materials include correspondence, memoranda, minutes, reports and studies, articles, clippings, itineraries, manuscript notes, typed manuscript drafts of books and articles, book reviews, subject files, and some photographs. Included are reports on mission activities in various countries in Africa (1968-1980), in Sudan (1985-1995), and in the Middle East (1981-1984). Some of the correspondence relates to the publication of Hopkins' books, articles, and speaking engagements.
